tag.raw: National Museum of the American Indian
tag.author: 25053835@N03

description._content: Photographer: David Sinclair, Non-Indian Subject: Museum of the American Indian, Research Branch (Annex), 1926-1989 Date Created: 1935 Catalog Number: N21651 Format: Acetate negative Dimensions: 5 x 7 in. Collection History: Presumably commissioned by George Heye to document the early work of the Museum of the American Indian. Description: View of the entrance of a concrete replica of a Sioux tipi on the Research Branch grounds, Museum of the American Indian/Heye Foundation, with painted warriors on horseback in midsection, and stars painted above, and leather or cloth door flap. Dwellings and fence in background. Place: Research Branch, Museum of the American Indian/Heye Foundation; New York City, Bronx, Pelham Bay; Bronx County; New York; USA Site Name: Research Branch, Museum of the American Indian/Heye Foundation Culture/People: Sioux Culture Hierarchy: Central Plains>Sioux Persistent URL:http://www.americanindian.si.edu/searchcollections/item.aspx?irn=345934 Repository:National Museum of the American Indian View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
